Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.flash_firmware_update.flash_firmware_update

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.drive import DriveType
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.drive_firmware_update import \
    DriveFirmwareUpdate



[docs]class FlashFirmwareUpdate(DriveFirmwareUpdate):

    # @override

[docs]    def storage_test_setup(self):
        # only pick SSD for testing
        self.test_control["drive_type"] = DriveType.SSD.value
        super(FlashFirmwareUpdate, self).storage_test_setup()
        self.live_update = self.test_control.get("live_update", False)
        self.nvme_update_action = self.test_control.get("nvme_update_action", 1)
        self.fw_slots = self.test_control.get("fw_slots", [0])
        self.force_update = self.test_control.get("force_update", False)


    # @override

[docs]    def update_drive_firmware(self, drive, version_name, bin_path):
        drive.update_firmware(
            version_name,
            bin_path,
            fw_slots=self.fw_slots,
            action=self.nvme_update_action,
            force=self.force_update
        )
        if not self.live_update:
            self.log_info("Resetting drive.")
            drive.reset()




[docs]def main():
    test = FlashFirmwareUpdate()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
